    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The main game loop.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()

      • tick

        private void tick()
        The Heart and soul of the game loop. Tick() is responsible for telling the game to update pretty much everything, including input, "win" conditions, and levelling up the game. A bug in Lanterna is currently preventing the cursor from ACTUALLY becoming invisible. I've filed bug reports, hopefully it's fixed soon.

      • drawMap

        private void drawMap()

      • levelUp

        private void levelUp()
        Increases the gameLevel of the game. Higher Levels = Higher Speeds. (To Encourage Power Up Use.)

      • updateCup

        private void updateCup()
        Updates the postion of the cup on the screen. If the cup reaches an edge cup.toggleLeft is called to change its direction. Passes Level to adjust cup speed.

        TODO: Move this functionality into the Cup.update() method after creating a real gameLevel.

      • updateScreen

        private void updateScreen()
        Checks to see if the screen's size has changed. If it has, it does a refresh cycle and moves the cup to the appropriate y location. Updates the game screen.

      • drawStartLoc

        private void drawStartLoc()

      • drawPlayer

        private void drawPlayer()

      • drawCup

        private void drawCup()
        See this is what I mean. This function is painfully obvious. Draws the cup to the screen.

      • checkWin

        private boolean checkWin()
        Checks to see if the ball is in the cup. If it is, it resets the player's position to the top of the screen, and increments the player's score. If Not it checks the remaining number of lives, if there are lives remaining, it resets the player to the top of the screen and decrements the player's lives by 1. If the player is out of lives, it runs the GameOverMenu state.

      • checkObstacleCollisions

        private void checkObstacleCollisions()

      • reset

        private void reset()
        Resets the Player's Postion back to the top of the board

      • drawScoreBoard

        private void drawScoreBoard()
        Draws The Scoreboard on the bottom of the screen. seriously, this is pretty self commenting, isn't it?

      • pauseResume

        public void pauseResume()
        Toggles Whether Or Not The State Is Paused;
